def_cn: 适宜的；合适的；适当的；恰当的
def_en: You use proper to describe things that you consider to be real and satisfactory rather than inadequate in some way.

def_cn: 正确的；准确的；最合适的
def_en: The proper thing is the one that is correct or most suitable.

def_cn: 得体的；合乎体统的；正派的
def_en: If you say that a way of behaving is proper, you mean that it is considered socially acceptable and right.

def_cn: 严格意义上的；真正的；本身的
def_en: You can add proper after a word to indicate that you are referring to the central and most important part of a place, event, or object and want to distinguish it from other things which are not regarded as being important or central to it.
